summary: Mickey Pearson is an American expatriate who became rich by building a highly profitable marijuana empire in London. When word gets out that he's looking to cash out of the business, it soon triggers an array of plots and schemes -- including bribery and blackmail -- from shady characters who want to steal his domain.

reviews.content: It was alright. I've seen better work from Guy Ritchie and The Gentlemen felt like a watered-down, dusted-off version of Snatch. The aesthetic is also very similar to Snatch's but seemed to lose the little edge or bite it had back in 2000. Perhaps it is why I was expecting something more from The Gentlemen. The acting is alright, mostly all well-known actors, most of them have worked with Guy Ritchie in the past and are mostly known for gangster-inspired films. Although I felt unimpressed by McConaughey's performance, the stoic-suave-too-cool kind of guy was archetype-y and felt almost hollow. Could also be the writing itself.

Solid 8, laughed a few times
Straight story, no glaring brain dead moments.

What i love is how the movie was recounted. Would love a sequel and more backstories on the character. Wish it was a longer film.
Colin Farrell is so god damn good in this. I can excuse the performances of McConaughey and Strong because of him. Hugh Grant also shines.
This Movie was so good! My Husband I loved it. Excellent cast and storyline. Keeps you very tuned in because of all the twists and turns. Children and sensitive viewers should not watch.
Favorite Guy Ritchie film ever. Fantastic
Best movie I have ever seen, rewatched multiple times and will continue to. Would recommend.

I'm annoyed I like this. I usually don't like guns,violence and intertwining capers,who's done it ect. I did however enjoy most of it despite,because the actors are damn entertaining .Maybe it was my mood.
Excellent movie. Fun well acted story, highly recommend.
The Movie is Guy Ritchie being himself. The movie is a blast and a half
A fun ride but I thought it was going to be a bit darker. But I'll take any film like this with Ritchie behind the helm.

Not Guy Ritchie’s greatest, maybe, but I liked that he moved beyond his four-plots-all-going-awry-and-circling-back-to-each-other formula and Hugh Grant was great as the seedy muckraker recounting the possible storyline in order to try and get a cut. Not sure what Matthew McConaughy’s accent was supposed to be, though.
An excellent watch - hilarious British gangster romp along the lines of Lock Stock & Two Smoking Barrels.

Brilliant film except for one major flaw... Hugh Grant! Would have been considerably better with someone else in that role!
Also... controversial opinion, there was an overuse of the C word. And despite this generally being listed as one of more favourite words to use, it lost all meaning in this film.
Love this film….that's it! That's the review!!
Great movie, good script,  good balance 👌🏽

Don't know what it is about Matthew McConaughey, but I'm not quite a fan of his 100%. I think that he does the same exact role in every single movie. It does not deliver anything else. I really wish that he would develop his characters and not be so one-sided. I think that he is a great actor in certain things, but most things are not. And this film is one of them. I think this is another film that was heed up to be bigger than what it should've been. It was definitely a boring experience that wasted my time. I think if you enjoy this type of film, great, I think that's an amazing. But this definitely one of those that could just sat on the shelf.

It was simply amazing. The casting was superb, the action was jam packed and exciting, and the overall feel of the movie made it seem like you were really there with them, selling bush and killing for cash.

The Gentlemen is a fresh spin on the crime genre, elevated with effortless British charisma. This film sweeps you along with terrific performances, cheeky dialogue, and slice-and-dice action sequences. The screenplay is fast-paced and high energy, with outrageous plot twists demanding your attention. Its witty, fun, and relentlessly entertaining, leaving me craving for more even after it was over.

It was a bit too violent and too dark for me in parts. Also, something about a lot of the acting and especially the dialogue just seemed really over the top and unbelievable. Normally I love non-PC gangster movies but this one just didn't quite sell me. I probably would have liked it better if the bad guys (which was nearly all the characters basically) had ended up in jail or killed.

Absolutely brilliant English gangster movie.  
Hugh Grant was amazing in this.
cool film matthew mcconoughy is great guy richie doesnt disappoint.

This movie does so many things so well. Though it is expected from a Guy Ritchie film, the style is unmatched. The cast was perfect. No role felt like it would have been better with a different actor, even though that may be the case for some of them. Charlie Hunnam has good report with both Hugh Grant and Matthew McConaughey. The acting was done very well and very quick. As for the writing and directing, the quick jumping around through the story can be off-putting or odd on the first watch. However, after watching it a second time, I found it much easier to follow. The film is decent fun if you watch it once. However, I have found the more I watch it, the better it becomes. One of my personal favorites! 90/100
mi è piaciuta molto la recitazione dei personaggi principali e la costruzione della storia. unica pecca le sparatorie e le situazioni che a volte sono molto surreali.
So good. Absolutely go for it if you are looking for value added entertainment.
Um bom filme,sendo que ultimamente vemos as mesmas coisas mesmas ideias,o filme é cliche sim,porém as atuações e os nuances são ótimos.
One of my favourite movies for the year. Interesting story, good characters and well executed.
Amazing movie, guy Ritchie coming back to the screen. He just gave to those who enjoyed his old movie exactly what did they expected. This Brits gangster movie is just what we wants and needs

The plot, the twists, the acting. It is one of the best, if not the best movie I've ever seen. Must watch. I appreciate that the gangster style of the movie is not sickening and overbearing. It's that old school type of gangster that keeps you interested in the plot, trying to figure out where each character will end up in the end. I loved brainstorming ideas trying to figure out what the different plot twists and end might be, but they all failed at being correct. That's what made me love this movie. I still rewatch it from time to time and it is interesting finding little details in the story and sets that I might've missed the first times watching.
Typical Ritchie movie, just makes you feel great watching a good movie again!
Loved it, in an era of dross film and TV making ,this was a great reminder to the days of losing yourself in a fun film without being lectured or promoting some message.
Loved the Movie. Fun twists and turns throughout.

Excellent movie. Watched it perhaps 5 times and will watch it many more times. Great plot, great acting and of course with all Guy Ritchie films, epic dialogue. Only downer is the plot is fast paced, but that just means you get to watch it a second time to let it all fully sink in!
If you like any of Guy Ritchie's films, especially Snatch, then you will enjoy this one. The cast is great, with Hugh Grant giving the best performance. Very funny and enjoyable film.
This is not snatch at all. It is a movie that gets caught up in its cinematography and outfits rather than an actual good plot. Dropped out at 30 minutes.

Can you learn an old dog new tricks? No matter how good the old tricks where, eventually they get stale. This is no Snatch or LSaTSB, and as such not one of Richie's best. My main complaint is that the casting feels off. To name only a few, Charlie Hunnam, Hugh Grant, and Henry Golding try too hard and never feel genuine. Like with Revolver, Richie swings and misses.

This is the type of Guy Ritchie movie I love and what made me get into his movies in the first place (like Lock Stock, and Snatch).  It has the jokes the crime and just enough action to make it fun, this one is a home run for me, well-done Guy.
A fun watch many exciting scenes.
This movie was great! Matthew McConaughey killed it as usual. Action movie with loads of twists.
Another great-written movie. Really enjoyed it.
Such a masterpiece, I love watching the work of Matthew and Charlie Hunnam did an awesome job in here too. Good soundtrack, story, actors and everything!
Stylish, with compelling characters perfectly cast and acted. It's gruesome in places and has made me see Hugh Grant in a totally different light.

The last film I watched was "The Gentlemen". It's one of my favorite movies directed by Guy Ritchie. I definitely recommend watching this movie! It's really entertaining and it has a style of "an old" gangster movie. It has an interesting plot. The cast are brilliant and actors play so naturally! For example, it's unusual to see Hugh Grant playing such tricky character but he made me believe that he almost acts the same in real life. So when you're watching this movie you can immerse yourself into a different world.
There are many jokes and funny moments in this movie. I can say that I laughed a lot! The musical accompaniment is great too! 
Anyway I recommend watching this movie after a hard day, when you want to relax and when you need something that can lighten your mood! I wish you all a pleasant viewing!
Great original movie with a great cast
Really good film. Like all Guy Ritchie films, it has a great cast of many characters. I love Guy Ritchie's style and this one is up there.
Amazing just amazing
Great story and ending. It's long but worth it
Awsome awsome film love guy Richie films he never ever disappoints brilliant film could watch over and over awsome cast too
Thoroughly enjoyed this movie
Brilliant. Terrific. Fast paced. Clever script. Great acting.
Rubbish. They all sounded like they took English lessons from Dick van Dyke. As for the weed plants they looked  like something from the day of the triffids. Don't bother.
Very creative story line.

A welcome return to Guy Ritchie's impeccable story telling.  I enjoyed the ebb and flow and found myself swept along quite happily pausing only to decide I've never seen Hugh Grant more impressively enliven a character.  Had I set more demands upon the plot development, I'd probably found reason to complain but the sheer entertainment value was highly enjoyable.
Awesome! Great acting! Hugh Grant, Charlie Hunnam, Colin Farrell and of course Mathew McConaughey are all entertaining! Laugh out loud and action filled! Classic Guy Ritchie! Loved it!!
All the characters were pretty shallow and boring.
I adore this movie! So well written and very funny!

More Guy Ritchie Gold..!! Another Classic to go up there with Snatch, Revolver, and Rock n' Rolla...!! If you Love witty, gritty, too notch, British gangster movies this is another from the king of the genre you won't want to miss!!
An absolute MUST see with close captioning on.

This was great. Pure fun. Some fun time times and plot twists to figure out. Some foreseeable but all good. Great British banter. Also helps that it's filled with early 2000 romcom heartthrobs. My old millennial self loved it.
Pretty Good! I enjoyed it.

The first thought I had when watching this movie was it's numerous amounts of flashbacks and cut aways to other scenes which I must say I was surprised by how well it manages to do this format compared to other films. This did get a bit confusing at parts mainly the beginning due to the onslaught of information that does start to make more sense as the film goes on but I was able to follow it all none the less. The characters are all very well written and very different to eachother which helps with keeping the audience interested and not getting bored of the movie and I appreciate the subtle humour in scenes to keep people entertained. That's not to say that the overall plot didn't keep me hooked, I can only compare the narration to that of a third person picture book. There is not much description of the scenes from the narration but that isn't required when you are spoon fed the satisfactory visuals and visual storytelling that the movie puts across. One thing I didn't enjoy too much was the overdramatisation of some people, specifically in the terms of the unrealistic way people communicate with eachother and the stereotypical British way of talking and language, this is only some though and the overall generalisation of cast is very well. Each actor does absolutely amazing in their role especially Charlie Hunnam as Raymond Smith, Colin Farrell as Coach and Hugh Grant as Fletcher, that's not to say that the rest of the cast do not do truly incredible in their part. The character of Fletcher is a true stand out and does perfectly as the narrator of this movie and the narration really put this movie together for me and I personally found his and Raymond's part of the story the most enjoying
Enjoyable...ever see "Snatch'?
The first 40 min I was a bit bored but then I started enjoying it. Gangsters movie full of suspence scenes.
In my opinion, one of the greatest films of all time
Fun from start to finish, Guy Ritchie at his best
That was fun, waiting sequle.
Great cast. A serious movie with a fun feel to it.

Saw yesterday out of my wife suggestion, and I have to say I loved it!
Finally an "old style" gangster movie, reminded me of original Tarantino but a bit more serious and coherent, with sour comedy instead of unnecessary excesses.
It's a really entertaining movie, loved the actors, the story, the suspence.
The movie is very good, I went to watch it in the movies without expecting anything very good, and I was surprised.
Another gem by Guy Ritchie, plain and simple. As usual, great writing, acting and twists and turns all over the place. I was hooked from beginning to end.

The narrative method they used to tell the story tended to ruin my sense of immersion and it felt overly complicated. The ending didn't feel like that big of a payoff. The movie has constant "twists" and feels disorienting, and then at the end it's like "Oh, ok, is that finally it? Alright". It was not terrible but they tried to be too clever about things. The movie would have benefited from a more traditional narrative structure.

Guy Ritchie pulled off another fun and entertaining movie, which I loved from beginning to end. There's only one law in the jungle, and Guy Ritchie never lost sight of it. Thoroughly recommend this movie!

Wildly entertaining with a great cast. There isn't a boring moment in the movie, each character builds a strong on screen presence and delivers the swaggy proper British gangsta vibe this movie is based on.Reading some of the bad reviews makes me wonder what the critic was expecting. It's like watching a Disney movie and complaining it was too childish.
Very good movie, great cast.

I didn't have high hopes when I saw this. I am a fan of Ritchie, and I had heard excellent things about the movie. However, after seeing a few trailers, I didn't feel very excited.

I'm happy I gave it a shot. The script for the movie is superb. It's absurd that Hugh Grant is the star when there are so many outstanding performances. Give this movie a chance if you're on the fence as I was. You won't be sorry.

Guy Ritchie thinks the same movie, but crescendo, the mobsters grow from the status of likable thief to trendy barons. The idea is the same but filmed better, much more expensive. Everything is more expensive. Actors are no longer stars in the making, but mega stars. It is already a privilege to be part of Ritchie's cast. The music is excellent, as in every other film, a trademark of the director.
Just "Guy Richi" enough.

This is one of my favorite movies ever! It only gets better the more you watch it. I enjoyed it the first time I watched it. However, when I watched it second time, I loved it. And now I love it every time I watch it. The vibe of this movie is simply cooler than anything I have ever watched. It feels like a gangster-meets-weed movie. Matthew McConaughey is incredible in this film. Michelle Dockery is my favorite interpretation of an empowered and confident businesswoman. Their pairing is perfect. Charlie Hunnam, Hugh Grant, and Colin Farrell are each amazing in their respective roles. Every actor brought their A-game for this movie and it shows. I can only hope others enjoy this movie as much as I do. 9.5/10

FANTASTIC!!!!!BRILLIANT!!!!AMAZING!!!!
Every actor at the top of his game!!!!
Guy Ritchie made a modern crime MASTERPIECE...
WOW
Love this movie ! It was funny and bad ass , G uy Ritchie does it again!
Not much depth to it, but a solid action movie if that's what you're looking for.
Well made movie with perfect casting. The story is strong and not as predictable as most. The over the top storytelling is the only flaw. Trying to hard to be like Tarantino.

A nicely woven tale that, perhaps, has one too many twists for its own good.  The casting was superb, as each actor seems to have been fitted into the perfect square hole.  The dialog maintains its entertainment value through wit, snarkiness and charm, without going overboard into comedy.  There are some pacing problems where a more robust editing job could have improved the overall enjoyment factor.
You get what Guy Ritchie always does, a good British Gangster Movie.
Guy Ritchie is one of my favorite directors. I think is his best movie. An absolute must to see.
Just about as good as it gets from Ritchie
Yeah, this is better than CATS.

Really a satisfaying movie to see.
I've enjoied every seconds and I liked the idea of the change of prospective.
Long dialogues and well written.
Alright, alright, alright!!!!
Though it may not hit the high lines of Guy Ritchie, the gentlemen won't disappoint its viewers - Thrived in a jumpy plot it stands tall as a solid movie
Really simple twist, but when it hits you, it's just your minds goes blank for a sec. That's it.

This is a classic Guy Ritchie movie and it's very good. You will find here everything that you may love in Ritchie's movies: 
1) Fun story with a lot of different characters which meet in the end at unusual circumstances.
2) Brilliant actors (Colin Farrell on of my favorites)
3) Good soundtrack during the whole movie and the main song by Bugzy Malone
So if you liked previous movies by Guy Ritchie, you will definitely like this
Fun movie.  A lot of foul language but that would be in keeping with the characters.  If the come out with a second one I will definitely watch.
Guy pulls off another stunner. You understand? Alright, Alright, Alright.

I loved everything about this movie.  The casting is impeccable and the story is fresh with a quintessential Guy Ritchie treatment that for some reason feels refined.  Great entertainment from start to finish.

Call Guy Ritchie a one-trick pony if you like, but one thing is for certain: When he makes one of his signature London gangster films; it's probably going to be an absolutely wild ride.  The Gentlemen is a result of what he does best. Outrageous characters who somehow become outright believable, brilliant if not brutal stories, (you have to be able to laugh at some seriously violent stuff) with all kinds of twists and turns, and usually satisfying outcomes because he's made you root for some for some rough characters of questionable moral character.  If you're not able to keep up with the Cockney accents and machine-gun dialogue (at times) put the subtitles on and just enjoy the ride.
it's on in the background......but I've found myself doing other things. Hugh Grant sampling various cockney villains...and trying not to be Hugh Grant
Problem with various Brit accents is that even if American ears can understand, the idioms used make it impossible.  Still, a fun film with the odd combination of comedy & violent action.

Amazing plot with so many twists and turns it keeps you engaged and on the edge of your seat. It is violent and gory so if that isn't your cup of tea then stay away, after all it is a gangster movie at its core.
Really, I'm not a woke-type viewer, but this movie was just grossly sexist and racist.  Ritchie has a puerile obsession with the c-word.  I have no idea why other viewers are loving this.
Some of it is confusing but its got the twists and turns that keep it interesting.
Was quite boring the whole movie.

Awesome!! Plot was fantastic! Guy Ritchie! I love you!
 Henry Golding and Hue Grant were great!
grand fun super actors
Great movie worth the watch
A hell of a lot of fun. This was the last film I saw before the start of the plague.
The McConasance in full effect.
Story moves fast. Characters are unique and quirky.
Fun way to navigate the plot of a movie. But so much of it meandered from one character to the next without much substance. (52%)
Beautiful, beautiful cinema.
Amazing, funny and brilliant British humor.

You can either believe all the 5-star reviewers who ironically have only seen this movie, and only provide a single generic sentence (cough, cough... probably got paid)... or you can take my word for it: this is a piece of crap.
It opens with Hugh Grant cussing and spinning some tall tale about a cannabis empire in the UK and the people who run it... and then he goes on and on and on about... who knows what? And the longer it goes on, the more shallow the characters get. And the more cartoony and uninteresting the whole story becomes.
There's the wife of the cannabis empire owner who happens to own the only all-female garage. Then, some generic Asian guy who wants to move in on the territory. And some hoodlums who not only rob mobsters, but display the whole thing on YouTube. And this is the "good" stuff...
This is NOTHING like Snatch or Lock Stock & 2 Smoking Barrels -- except the color pallete and cinematography. Storywise - it's a total generic mess. Nothing new. Nothing interesting. Nothing worth watching... even if it's free.
Do yourself a favor: skip this and watch Guy Ritchie's older stuff. 
Or just run by your local Sherwin-Williams store, get yourself a can of Roman Column, splash some on a wall... and watch it dry. It would take as long as this horrible cash grab - and at least your walls would look nicer.
great cast, interesting turn of events, but in all: a little lame and nothing new
totally my type of movie and I love guy ritchie's style
The last movie I watched before the pandemic shut down all the theaters. I'm glad it was a pleasure I get to experience THIS MASTERPIECE!
The Gentleman has a refreshingly complex plot that is efficiently written and a decent amount of fun, but it's somewhat lackluster characters don't make the film memorable.

Guy Ritchie thug movie.  It is slick and stylish, with a top notch cast and decent acting.  I never liked thug movies going all the way back to the Godfather.  Why should I care if any of these people live?  OK maybe Colin Farrell or McConaughey is slightly more empathetic than the rest of the lot, but ultimately I didn't really care.  The conceit of a movie in a movie was just pretentious, although I did enjoy seeing Hugh Grant get his.  Twists and turns abound in this movie, although almost to the point of a ping pong match.

This is a unique and complex movie.   Matthew McConaughey is very good as the American head of a Marijuana empire in Great Britain struggling with the complexity of trying to keep his empire flourishing amidst double crosses and warring gangs.   The film is visually sleek and filled with twists.  The characters are clever and funny.  While McConaughey is the center of the film and very good, so are Hugh Grant, Michelle Dockery, and Charlie Hunnam.  Colin Farrell, once again proves he is an actor with great range.   The rest of the supporting cast is very compelling.   The movie is well filmed and well directed.   It is one you must be engaged in to follow because of the language used and the plot twists.   This is Guy Ritchie in top form.
8.4/10—-fun flick! Thought I had it figured out a few times but there were some fun twists.
8.4/10—-fun flick! Thought I had it figured out a few times but there were some fun twists.

I just watched "The Gentlemen" by Guy Ritchie. First off, hats off to Ritchie. I mean, say what you want, but it would have been easy for him to coast doing the same kind of film every time. He didn't though, he branched out with the "Sherlock Holmes" films, "King Arthur," and "The Man from U.N.C.L.E." Now, let's be honest some of those didn't work. Still though, it took stones to risk his career. *********************************************************************************************************************************This film is a return to form for Ritchie. There are some casting issues, but the story is as solid as "Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels," "Rock'N'Rolla," or "Snatch." The only fault the film has is it's casting. We all know I'm talking about the "alright, alright, alright" "Magic Mike" man himself Matthew McConaughey. It's not that he's a bad actor, but just that he doesn't fit in the film. He stands out in every scene. One could only imagine that he was a studio choice. Apparently, he can't do a British accent. It really feels like they rewrote the film to accommodate this fact. On the flipside thought Colin Farrell delivers another low key genius performance. The rest of the cast is just as flawless. ******************************************************************************************************************************What really shines is the writing. Ritchie and Co. are in rare form. This is a screenplay tighter than a nun's box. Sorry, I just watched the film and the dialogue is so infectious it's rubbed off on me. The plot is just as well crafted. Guy Ritchie is also a genius when it comes to instant character development. He really is a writer that makes great story telling look effortless. I do acknowledge that he didn't write it alone, but how many rings did Jordan get before people realized that he carried everything he touched? Guy Ritchie is a great story teller, it's no secret, and this film is just another feather in his cap.
Not to the level of Lock stock or Snatch, but It's by far Guy Ritchie's best work since and a nice return to form into the gangster genre.
Very fresh comedic moments in an era of PC comedies
Incrível. Desiludido porque acabou, reviravoltas fantásticas. Vou acompanhar mais trabalhos do realizador

Guy Ritchie's recent works have been okay at best but this one is a good film. The movie has the classic Guy Ritchie style from the likes of Snatch. It's a crime movie about Mickey (Mathew McConaughey) and his drug empire. The cast is amazing. Michelle Rockery and Charlie Hunnam were the biggest surprisingly great. The rest of the star-studded cast did really well too. The movie was fun and had a lot of twists, but it should've ended earlier than it did. The last few minutes felt shoehorned in and serve no purpose other than to add more twists and overexplain what happened. It was still a good movie and I had a fun time. It was the most entertaining Guy Ritchie film in years.
One of my fav movies of all time
Refreshingly smart with subtlety.
A interestingly woven and very satisfying representation of power.

Good performances by many of the main cast, Grant, McConaughey, Hunnam, Farnell. Abit all over the place story wise could have been better with a more precise storyline too much jumping around with small fragments that werent necessary. More budget spent on film and less on actors would have made movie better. This type of film should have been used to bring new English talent into the forefront rather than big celebrity names being used. Other british movies in this genre are more memorable due to less know  actors being brought forward and giving great perfoamces. Not to take away from the big names in this movie they preformed well. Hugh grant and Colin Farnell giving the most memorable performances.
Unfortunately directing let this movie down and what could have been a classic British gangster movie with better directing but unfortunately this flaw has led to a less than memorable film. Overall 3 stars is generous, it is not due to acting or directing it is because it is something I would turn on in the background for some noise while doing odd tasks around the house but will never again sit down and watch from start to finish.

This is how the film works:
A 'cool guy' or girl comes in to explain how they have outsmarted another "cool guy".
 "Cool guy" number 2, explains how it he who has outsmarted cool guy number 1, usually before shooting or stabbing them and it just goes on like this. Check it, most scenes are just this.
The plot is a mess, the dialogue trying to be clever but it's bullshit and not even funny, I laughed twice. The acting is actually ok, given the shite they are being asked to say.
I dunno how aware Guy Ritchie is of this but the class stereotypes are ridiculous.
Every working class person wears a track-suite and baseball hat. Every posh person wears a suite or tweed except when you're a working class person who's on the up, then you wear a suite.

Ich habe die anderen Filme von Guy Ritchie genossen und freute mich darauf, diesen Film zu sehen. Die Besetzung ist exzellent und perfekt geeignet, um die farbenfrohen Charaktere darzustellen, die man normalerweise in einem Guy-Ritchie-Film findet. Hugh Grant und Colin Ferrell stehlen allen die Show.
Not a movie to be taken too seriously, it was an old fashionned diverting moment. Really appreciated the story, not complicated and just a little humoristic.
Nothing bad can be said about this film. It's perfect from the first second until last.

A brilliant addition to Guy Ritchie's portfolio. Funny, shocking and sharp and Hugh Grant's performance is a total mesmerising revelation. What on an earth has he been doing for the last 35 years ?  when he is capable of this.
The dialogue is funny and brilliant which brings this fun crime film to a much higher level than most.
Great stuff from Guy Ritchie.

I agree with the non-woke here (all the stuff about stereotypes etc.!) - not quite up with Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, but very good. Hugh Grant is very good, as are all the actors and actresses.

The Gentlemen is a comedy about a group of eccentric characters in the British criminal underworld who have lived long enough to see themselves become the establishment and who are aiming for better lives for themselves. The characters try and carry themselves with what they perceive to be a sense of professionalism, reasonableness and decency but they can't escape the sleazy and violent underpinnings of the criminal enterprise. Watching the characters navigate their dealings with a colorful vulgar vernacular in a world of up and coming thugs while trying to maintain a sense of respectability is highly comical, but there is something relatable to the characters trying to maintain equilibrium in both their chaotic circumstances and their goals. The movie is so endearing and enjoyable that it leaves the viewer yearning for a sequel when the story ends.

Guy Ritchie returns to his gangster roots with The Gentlemen, a crime comedy boasting actors who all seem to be having fun in their roles, dialogue that's a joy to listen to, an entertaining cast of characters and tons of stylish direction, even if it's not as memorable or as consistently funny as Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels and, to a greater extent, his magnum opus Snatch.
Brilliant, absolutely brilliant 👏 👌 👍💪

Matthew McConaughey is the star in this seedy underworld romp - and he's excellent - but a tour de force by Hugh Grant carries the narrative along (literally).  Lots of fun if you can stand the relentless swearing.
This movie was surprisingly good.  8.5 out of 10.

For older Guy Ritchie  fans. Offensive (homophobic and racist) and without likeable  characters are unlikeable. The film could have been shorter. English people cannot emulate American mobster films.  Some clever dialogue but otherwise predictable.  Highlight of the film was seeing Lady Mary speak in a working class accent.

Not a particular Richie fan, but loved this movie. It was so perfectly cast. McConaughey was as usual pretty faultless, Farrell was funny yet menacing with it. Hunnam was perfect and I didn't realise Grant had that performance in him. The story had twists and turns galore - a real treat.

What can I say, I'm a Guy Ritchie fan! Never fails to disappoint. The fast paced, witty dialogue laced with euphemism, rhyming slang and weak as water similie (see what I did there) keeps you on your toes and the lovely spread of gore and comedy makes it a joy to watch. As ever, Ritchie is vibrant and extra and I love every minute of it. A fantastic film that I would happily watch again.

I'd have given this 4.5 stars (instead of 3.5) if the casting was better.
It's like the casting director has just picked all the people she's ever fancied but who don't suit the roles at all (with the exception of McConaughey who is the perfect mix of slick southern charm and occasional menace).
Hugh Grant does slightly better than I expected at trying to play a "geezer" but it's still pretty awful and anyone who walked into a pub talking like that would be laughed out of town as a lunatic who's thinks they're Michael Caine.
Jeremy Strong isn't really menacing enough for this kind of role in this kind of film.
Hunnam is OKish but still too much of a pretty boy and just looks out of place.
Dockery and Farrell were good though in their scenes.
Awesome Guy Richie movie with great acting from all. Reminded me of the great Lock, Stock & 2 Smoking Barrels also.

Guy Ritchie gangster movie - always enjoyable. Giving it top marks because of Hugh Grant. It can not be understated how brilliant he is. Looking just like himself, but still completely unrecognizable. Rest of the cast is good of course, but he runs aways with it.
Good fun.

Guy Ritchie returns to making the type of movie that he became famous for over 20 years ago and it makes for a really fun watch.  Does this London gangster caper work in 2020 like it did in 1998? 

Yes. But times have changed. Firstly the production is alot more developed. Secondly, times have changed. East end geezers don't really hang around pubs and markets anymore, do they? Everything is gentrified. People shop on Amamzon. Recording devices in everybody's pockets make crime difficult, and there is reference to this in the movie. This means that the movie is a little less raw and limits what Ritchie can get away.

That said it is nice to watch an old style movie and enjoy some loveable rouges up to no good. Hugh Grant is very adept as an East End low life journalist mixing with
the wrong crowd. Matthew McConaughey brings some Hollywood to the movie and faces off against Succession's Jeremy Strong. Apparently Strong is a very committed method actor which all of the other people on set (McConaughey included) find really annoying. Colin Farrell makes an amusing appearance and the only let down is by Charlie Humman (I spent half the movie trying to work out where he was from).

Ritchie made his name with Lock Stock and 2 smoking barrels and then went on to make Snatch. The Gentlemen followed suit and it's good an see and old fashioned gangster movie again.

Thought at first, great a guy Ritchie film it surely won't disappoint. I found this a long slog to watch from start to finish and felt it tried to hard to replicate lock stock and snatch with an up to date appearance.
Flimsy storyline although with a predictable twist of an ending, some acting average with the exception of Hugh grant and Mchonaghy!

The movie feels at least 20 years out of date. From the moment it starts with Mcconaughey ordering a pint and a pickled egg, I wanted to cringe. I thought it must be set in the 50s or something, but then he pulled out a mobile phone. When did Guy Ritchie last set foot in London? Irritating style. Contrived script. Like Brexit, a desperate throwback to some imaginary time when everyone was white.
Really enjoyed this. A bit silly but entertaining. Guy Ritchie does not disappoint.

Unfortunately this movie falls in line with what one expects from a cast of 100 celebrities. It is even worse than expected. A complete disaster unraveling bit by bit thanks to a narrator who is the main presence in the film. Yeah, how dumb is that? The story is so convoluted and boring that I could barely keep my eyes open so hypnotized was I by the snoring of the narrator. Big waste of time. Cut my losses after the first 40 minutes.

Watching this for just my 2nd time was such a treat today!  Incredible performances by ALL!  Interest level to the max and this movie had me guessing right to the very end again.  Loved it, again! 
Ritchie is still one of the very best directors on the planet and this is yet another showcase film for him to prove that!

My favorite movie of all time. Guy Ritchie and his well picked cast all do an amazing job of telling the story of an underground drug network and a clever business man's plan to take it all over. The entire cast does a fantastic job of keeping the fast paced story interesting and captivating. Guy Ritchie's cinematic style is perfect for this story and I don't think I would change a thing about it. If you like Guy Ritchie this is a must see, and if you don't... Watch it anyways, it's worth it.

As a sucker for Guy Ritchie films I liked this one. As always, he's put together a solid ensemble of actors and kept to that slappy gangster theme. Hugh Grant and Colin Farrell were standouts for me in this one.
The way how the story plays from the beginning all the way to the end made this movie very interesting. Absolutely loved it.

Believe the bad reviews saying this was boring. In fairness I did not watch much of it because I could not tolerate more than a few minutes of the beginning. Tried skipping ahead 20 - 30 minutes to see if it picked up and it was like the scene did not even change. That was all I could take.

This didn't have great ratings on Netflix or IMDb, but given the cast I wanted to give it a try.  I thought it was okay.  It had the feel of a lot of crime-based movies these days.  The comic bits were decent.  A supporting role was played by Michelle Dockery (Lady Mary Crawley of Downton Abbey).  It took me a while to place her. The role was so very different it was a bit jarring.  She was swearing like crazy which seemed so out of character for the prim Lady Mary.  ;-)
Great movie. Reminiscent of Lock Stock etc but less entertaining and gritty. The cast was great. I'd watch the sequel
amazing writing. amazing acting. amazing movie.
Great story. Compelling characters.

An extremely entertaining film that presents Guy Ritchie completely let loose, "The Gentlemen" stands probably his best film since "Snatch," even beating it out in some areas. From start to finish, the action is relentless and brutal, and the acting is done phenomenally, especially from McConaughey, Hunnam, Farrell, and Grant, which absolutely carry this film. The story feels unique and fresh, and the comedy is gutbustingly hilarious, though it can be offensive to some at parts. Really the only complaint that I have is that sometimes the plot and story tends to become so absurd to the point where it either doesn't make sense or it is quite literally impossible for most to follow. However, after the first act of the film, the story picks up its pace to deliver an extremely entertaining and rewatchable crime film.
Hilarious! Loved it - and really impressed with Hugh Grant's accent.
I love this movie, everyone was brilliant. I've watched it 5 times and will probably watch it 5 more.
This movie was freaking excellent.Guy Ritchie really did a fantastic job with the cast and story.

This movie is beautifully shot and written cleverly as a throwback to ritchie's roots. A walk through of the screenplay narrated through out the movie gives for an entertaining slang riddled crime adventure that we have come to love so much from Guy Ritchie. His budgets clearly being upped makes for an almost too beautiful of a movie for such a grimy story.. but it's gorgeous to watch and fun to participate in.
Absolutely fantastic
AMAZING. FUNNY. HUNNAM, FARRELL, GRANT AND MCCONAUGHEY ARE THE BEST IN THE FUC$1# WORLD. 5/5
Great actors, great performances. An original way to tell the story.
Great plot twists and suspense. I do think it is a little sad how the story was told, it slowed down an action movie that didn't need to be slowed down

When the lion is hungry he eats ! 
I enjoyed the movie duo to the great cast featuring the oscaric Matthew and sons of anarchy's Charlie, dialog and some lit comedy action.
Great London crime romp. Entertaining.

Finalmente Guy voltou a forma, filmão!
Cheio de surpresas como 2 canos!
Fabuloso!

A return to form by Guy Ritchie, back doing what he does best...British Gangster films with witty, often brutal dialogue, clever convoluted storytelling and script-writing and an ability to collate some high profile collection of actors into a fantastic delve into London's seedy underbelly.  Not quite up with Lock Stock or Snatch, it is still a huge upturn from other less well received of his films.  It may take a little while into the film to get your head around Hug Grant doing his best Brick Top impersonation but the actors all nail their parts perfectly, Charlie Hunnan and Matthew McConaughey are superb.  Well worth a watch.
Guy Ritchie did it again. This Is the latest in the line of great British gangster comedies.
One of my favorite movies ever, Guy Ritchie style movie, loved it. 10/10

I loved this movie. Great characters, great plot and great action. A lot of the criticism I've seen for this movie is about the violence, racial and homophobic slurs and cursing. It's a movie about a bunch of drug dealing, murdering criminals, I don't think such individuals actually care about being politically correct and wouldn't be believable if they were prim and proper like royalty (hell I'm pretty sure the royal family are not so proper in private).
I liked "the toddlers" BUT at the same time I marvel at their stupidity at recording their every criminal activity, but this generation is that dumb. Hugh Grant and Colin Farrell were excellent, Matthew McConaughey and Charlie Hunnam were convincingly menacing beneath their veneer of good manners. 
Watch it you won't regret it, unless cursing and violence offends your delicate sensibilities.
Brilliant acting, colorfull dialogues, twists and turns, and the great direction of the master of the Britt gang movie... A delight.
Great film underrated and well worth watching
Guy pierce makes great movies.Great cast with great writers.

A typically comedic gangster movie from director Guy Ritchie that, whilst not his best offering, is certainly entertaining enough.
Starring Matthew MCConaughey, Colin Farrell, Hugh Grant and Charlie Hunnam, it is a fairly predictable story of an upperclass drug dealer and the dodgy deals he makes in order to outsmart the competition. More of a victory of style over content it has to be said but certainly passable.
Amazing movie. Don’t watch this one with your grandma. Exciting fresh take on a drug king pin. McConaughey smashed it out of the park.
Funny in places, gangster vibe.
Just your typical Guy Richie film. Great fun.

I’m just gonna say it: I don’t think I get Guy Ritchie’s presentation style. The characters seemed cool, it wasn’t an excessively long movie, and the visuals were great. That being said, I found Guy Ritchie’s style confusing as hell. Am I just too used to linear storytelling or is it just confusing? You be the judge. My judgement is that this movie has a cool look and an interesting idea, but I lost track thanks to Guy Ritchie’s non-linear plot. I like movies that make you think, but not like this. Just to end on a positive, I liked how it was pitched as a movie within the movie, so there’s that, one step closer to understanding and appreciating it.
It's a stale rehashing of Lock Stock and Snatch with a convoluted plot that was needless.
This film was thoroughly enjoyable. A well directed action/gangster film, it had good twists, excellent character devlopment and stellar acting.
classic guy ritchie, but some dialogue isn't as funny/profound as he thinks it is
I loved the style and direction this film took. It's Guy Ritchie showing off that he's still got it. I hope he's got more in the bag.
Fantastic thinker! Keeps your attention the whole way through.

Matthew McConaughey, Colin Farrell, Hugh Grant, Henry Golding, Tom Wu, Charlie Hunnam, Michelle Dockery and Jeremy Strong are just part of an all-star cast that each gets enough screen time, which makes this film a Marti Gras of character development, plot lines and sub-plot lines. And it doesn't all come together cheaply or dishonestly. Perhaps Guy Ritchie's best, especially for non-Guy followers. Hugh Grant should have received a Best Supporting Actor nod. "The Gentlemen" was great fun.

Excellent thinking movie.  Embrace the confusion, you won't regret it.  Lots of twists and turns and the perspectives of the characters aren't actually clear until almost the very end.  I really don't know if anyone but Guy Ritchie could do this and I'm not a Guy Ritchie fan.  I found the second Holmes, Game of Shadows, to be just a little too oblique to know what was going on and too hackneyed, grey, "chatty", and bleak to care.

Michelle Dockery is brilliantly out of typecast as a sexy, acerbic yet soft and feminine, love of the main character's life.  She is submissive to him while powerful, competent, and fearless at the same time and her role is critical to the plot.  She's definitely out of any "Downton" curse.

Matthew McConaughey, who I've suffered through his "too cool" in other roles, plays this perfectly believable.

Colin Farrell and Hugh Grant are also completely out of any typecast.  Farrell brings so many new dimensions to this character that you really lose sight of who he is.  Same with Grant who is so gritty and slimy you can't imagine him in a rom-com.

Kudos to Ritchie for finding these characters in these actors and weaving them into the story

I'm not sure why Rex Reed hates Ritchie so much, but it seems to be emotional.  In the film, there's an exchange between the main character, a truly productive man, and gossip rag editor, who creates nothing, rather leeches off others' creations with vile printer word.  The leech is rebuffed by the main character, rather than shown respect.  Throughout the film, the leech is portrayed as a pathetic weasel brilliantly woven into the script.  I, obviously, don't know this for sure, but frequently art imitates life and the subtext of this film may very well be an expression of Ritchie's perspective on Reed.  Yet it's critical to plot and not obvious until I read Reed's review of this film.

I certainly see the similarities and I only just became aware of Reed's excessive derision of Ritchie as "an incompetent director" while Reed is really incapable of creating anything of substance and leeches off the products of others.  Would Reed be turning tricks on Highland if nobody made movies?  Maybe. 

This movie is a mental challenge with plenty if action and dark humor as the story unfolds.  It's one of those classics worth a rewatch

The Gentlemen is the big misstep in the admirably coherent career of Guy Ritchie as a filmmaker. The script is really poor. And not even that spectacular cast can sustain a mediocre history in a boundless new attempt to be cool and, as an early and very enjoyable movies of Ritchie as his remarkable debut with "Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels", "Snatch", or "RocknRolla": transgressor. Guy Ritchie finishes in this movie by repeating himself with his characters and clichés to be finally, boring.
I couldn't look away, and if you dare to, you'll miss it. Every moment packed with an A list cast, performing the perfect script, for the perfect movie. I wouldn't change a thing.

The Gentlemen - 8/10. After delivering Aladdin in the summer of 2019, Guy Ritchie returns to his smaller, more comfortable genre of crime comedy. Headlined by an Allstar cast that includes Matthew McConaughey, Charlie Hunnam, Henry Golding, Colin Farrell, Michelle Dockery, and Hugh Grant, this film delivers on so many levels. Not as good as some of his most revered works, The Gentlemen is more focused on the characters in the film. Everyone in the movie is well casted and all the performers deliver their characters amazingly. They all seem to be having fun with their respective characters, which is great to see. The intricate web of deceit and shady business is delicately woven as the film goes on. The story is narrated for the majority of the film in almost a meta way by Hugh Grant's character. We get to witness how things go about in the underworld of the UK, and how things go to crazy shit in a comedic way help give the film the energy that it delivers. All the loose ends connect in such a great way that you will feel satisfied as the movie approaches its climax. It's a scoundrel, foul mouthed, fun yet well placed film. It might not be for everybody, but if you're a fan of Ritchie's previous works, and if you're a fan of dark humour, this is the film for you!

Guy Ritchie's signature control intellectually specialized through the gangster genre entertainingly relies on the organically brilliant cast's performative wits over the disengaging convolution that taints the storytelling despite classily defined by its different approach. (B)
Fun movie, not as good as Guy's other classic but very enjoyable. 75/100

Fun, if you don't mind vulgarity and blood, and I don't. It is a story in a story, that takes you on a two hour drive through the seamier side of British aristocrats and the basic good, bad guys.  McConaughey is smooth as usual and surrounded by a very good cast of proper villains who cut in and out of the same, two stories, so well.  It moves along like a well oiled machine where the parts fit well, in spite of the occasional monkey wrench thrown in by the "bad" guys. The fun is, they are all bad, just in different degrees. I think the very good cast are all in fine form and have fun with a film that has a laugh or two and violence in many forms. Hey why not, it's a movie.

If you like guy Ritchie's films. This is as good as snatch if not better. I really, really enjoyed this film. Hugh Grant is really good, because he isn't playing Hugh grant, like he normally is. Great film.

A return to form for guy Ritchie, great cast, great script and plenty of quotable moments. But if a throwaway generic plot but it's we'll written enough to forgive. To sum up it's a modern day snatch that you can watch 10 times over and still enjoy

One of the worst films I've seen in years.
The cast tried their best and some were okay - but the writing was self-indulgent and over-written - the plot was unnecessarily confusing - and the casual racism, homophobia, and misogyny were enough to turn my stomach more than a few times.
I tried to think, if Richie removed the racism et al, would this have been a good movie? I still say no. The most interesting characters were the most underutilized - Dry Eye, Ros, and Coach (with a special mention for Bunny).
This movie is just ... bad. I think I might have lightly chuckled once or twice. The rest was hard to get through.

This is a great movie. All of the roles are performed really well and the action sequences are shot really well. Hugh Grant is actually hilarious, so is Farrell. But to be honest i could probably mention any one of the cast here. Plenty of twists cos its a guy ritchie movie after all, i think there was one every minute it seemed. One of the best movies I've seen in a while

The Gentlemen brings an interesting take to the gangster movie genre. Most of the movie is being told as a story to one of the main protagonists in said story. The plot works very well with this format and keeps you guessing along the way. The cast is great with Matthew Mcconaughey, Charlie Hunnam, Colin Farrell, and Hugh Grant as the standouts. The directing and cinematography is also great giving unique shots for each scene. All of this combined is recipe for a great movie, I would even go as far as the call it a must watch for fans of the crime genre.
Excellent from start to finish

The Gentlemen is an excellent film. While it struggles at time to remain understandable with many moving parts, and suffers a bit from less-than-perfect pacing, the film recovers with many unexpected curve balls that relieve the tedium of formulaic plots. Sure, you could say this is Guy Ritchie's rehashing of earlier films but it's all worth it to see Matthew Mcconaughey play a weed dealing gangster screaming about how the lion roars.
An underused stellar cast. An average GR film. There are so many better ones.
I really enjoy some of the lecherous roles Hugh Grant has been playing recently.
The fast and smart dialogue are impressive. Unfortunately I couldn’t keep up with the subtitles.
Beautifully stylish and devilishly clever.This is Guy Ritchie's comfort zone and he nailed it .A must see no doubt in that.....
Second half saves it. Not a guy Ritchie guy , but likely his best here IMO.
Really funny, with actors who genuinely seem to be enjoying themselves.
Unique, fascinating story, hilarious and serious. This movie is lacking nothing.
Guy's Best Since Snatch.
Love the sequencing and manner the story is presented.  Good acting, good plot and good fun.
Solid Guy Ritchie movie nothing more, nothing less.

I really enjoyed this movie.  I particularly liked the relationship between Mickey and his wife.  I would definitely watch a sequel, if made.  All the stars were top notch. Loved smarmy Hugh Grant!  Far jump from Daniel Cleaver!  Highest marks.

Guy Ritchie is back to his old tricks and this film is more in the vein of LOCK, STOCK AND TWO SMOKING BARRELS and SNATCH. However, compared to those, this film desperately tries to recreate the magic of those films but fails in its attempt. As Ritchie is known for, many characters to introduce at the beginning, followed by a lot of misdirection before the final reveal. While it has an impressive cast and McConaughey star shines the brightest, the film was too loquacious for me. Most of the film is told from Hugh Grants POV, who plays an investigative journalist, who's blackmailing McConaughey via his right hand man, Ray (played by Charlie Hunnam). The film will either grip you or leave you bored. And while I wasn't entirely bored, I was somewhat ready for the credits to roll earlier than I would have wished.

I just can't with movies like this, Snatch, Layer Cake, etc.  I don't know if they're good, or bad, or what... it's like they make a movie I would like but then they do something in the editing room and I don't know what I am watching.  Do they just send different edited versions to different audiences and is that why I don't see what I think I'm going to see or what other reviewers suggest they saw?

Guy Ritchie does wonders with this riveting, clever tale of a flamboyant drug criminal underground. It's stylish and exceedingly fun with a colorful cast of characters portrayed by a foray of skilled high profile actors. 

I regret not being able to catch this film in theaters, just a entertaining ride thru and thru
It has its moments. Great cast, I've never been a huge Guy Ritchie fan though. I found this movie to be very forgettable
Hilarious, and very riveting. Sometimes a little hard to follow what's real and what isn't, but that doesn't make the movie any less fun.

Ritchie's best work in a long time, if not THE best he's ever done. Everything from the dialogue, to the editing and the wild set pieces pop, helping to balance out some of the more outlandish elements. Small nit-picks aside, it's pure fun, so strap in and enjoy!
Like how they put this together Mickey Pearson was ruthless

what a movie!
The plot keeps you engaged every frame and the acting is top class.
all lads did well.
waiting for the sequel

Best film of the last 12 months, although that isn't hard to achieve during this time, but this was an excellent film with some outstanding performances,
Really enjoyed it.

Pretty good decent smart British mafia film directed by the infamous guy Ritchie. I had some fun with this movie and I respect it's smart cleaver lines of dialogue so hands down to the writer. But this movie has a different vibe compared to other guy Ritchie films. For some reason to me it feels like it's a cheaply done movie that used all its budget on the stars like Hugh grant, Colin Farrell and of course the main showstopper Matthew mconahay. Maybe this movie simply isn't for me but I did have a decent time while watching meaning I wasn't bored out of my mind. But probably after writing this review I'll forget about this movie. I can see the appeal for most people for liking this. But it's just not my thing sorry not sorry.

Pretty good decent smart British mafia film directed by the infamous guy Ritchie. I had some fun with this movie and I respect it’s smart cleaver lines of dialogue so hands down to the writer. But this movie has a different vibe compared to other guy Ritchie films. For some reason to me it feels like it’s a cheaply done movie that used all its budget on the stars like Hugh grant, Colin Farrell and of course the main showstopper Matthew mconahay. Maybe this movie simply isn’t for me but I did have a decent time while watching meaning I wasn’t bored out of my mind. But probably after writing this review I’ll forget about this movie. I can see the appeal for most people for liking this. But it’s just not my thing sorry not sorry.

A successful American drug dealer in London wants to retire and has trouble in the process.  This is a fast moving Guy Ritchie crime film that relies heavily on flash-back/flash-forward scenes to develop the plot.  Mostly good acting with one or two exceptions, Pretty good character development.  If you like Guy Ritchie's films you will probably like this one; If not, you probably won't.
I haven't had this much fun since "Pulp Fiction."
